result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marshal Lashawn Murff

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Marshal Lashawn Murff.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff in court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien; both appear by video.  Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 45 FOR BRANCH 40.
Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court, defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a State vs. Lee hearing. Defense counsel Joseph Bastien has been appointed to this case by the public defenders office. Case ajdourned to preliminary hearing cout for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Matter to be heard in Br. 45 for Br. 40.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff not in court, defendant in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with SCRAM.  If SCRAM device is unavailable defendant to be released and placed on SCRAM waiting list.
 The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
 Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
 No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff in court with Attorney  Fred Richardson III via zoom.  Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff in custody. Mark Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant plea Not Guilty to Count 2.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
